head: Divorce Notice.
ab: TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, County of Thurston.
p: In the United States District Court for the Second Judicial District, holding terms at Olympia, W.T. November Term, 1866.
ab: Harriet S. Boye, vs Edward H. Boye. Petition for Divorce.
p: To Edward H. Boye, Defendent, and non-resident of the Territory of Washington:

YOU ARE HEREBY NOTIFIED that Harriett S. Boye, the Plaintiff in this cause, has filed a complaint against you in the said Court, which will come on to be heard at the first term of the Court which shall commence more than two months after the date of this publication, and unless you appear at the said term and answer the same will be taken as confessed and the prayer thereof granted.
The object of the said prayer and complaint dissolve the bonds of matrimony now existing between you and the plaintiff, on the grounds of abandonment and desertion and harsh and cruel treatment.
O. B. McFADDEN. Atty for Plaintiff.
